author: Special Correspondent
text:
Southern Railway will be operating special Suvidha trains from Chennai to Tirunelveli and Ernakulam in April to clear extra rush during the summer holidays.

Train no. 00601 from Chennai Egmore to Tirunelveli will leave at 10.45 p.m. on April 13 on the main line; in the return direction, train no. 00602 will leave Tirunelveli at 2.45 p.m. on April 17 on the chord line. Train no. 00605 for Ernakulam Junction will leave Chennai Central at 6.20 p.m. on April 13 and in the return direction, train no. 00604 will leave Ernakulam for Chennai at 7 p.m. on April 17, a Southern Railway press release said.

A note said that on Suvidha trains, the number of berths was divided into blocks of 20 per cent each with the first block being charged substantially lower than the last block of 20 per cent, allowing passengers who book early to get lower fares.

For instance, if a second AC fare is Rs. 1,240 for a regular train from Chennai to Madurai, the fares will be Rs. 1,540, Rs. 2,285, Rs. 3,015, Rs. 3,745 and Rs. 4,450, the note said. Similarly, against a fare of Rs. 315 between the two cities on a regular train, the fare on a Suvidha train will be between Rs. 415 and Rs. 1,135.
title: Book early to get lower fares for special Suvidha trains
